transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Hello.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Hey, Luis.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Got you all done. The reason that took so long is I just kind of also built all your equipment options while I was out there too.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Okay. Sure.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Um, I’d love to wrap up with you here.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Of course. Of course.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: So, what are you up to for the rest of the day?

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Oh, keep working. Just, um... keep working, really.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Nice. You work from home also?

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Yeah, yeah, most of the... most of the days.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Sometimes I go to the... I literally can’t work from anywhere else but your home, right?

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: I know. Right. Yeah. My job would be betrayed if I work from... [Laughs]

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Yeah, AI is a... a big thing, man. But, um... so just to... let's go right to just the differences here. I just wanted to show you... um... so remember before how we had that before... that uh... below freezing temperature? At 41.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Oh, yeah.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: It’s good to see. Um... And now we have that 20 degree difference as well.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Ah, okay.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Just did a really fancy chart there for you. And got you in good shape.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Okay.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: All that to say... definitely Band-Aided.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Sure. Yeah, yeah, yeah. It’s old. It’s an old unit.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Right. So... the... when it comes to just what to expect here in the future, I would say... one month to two months, I think we'll start to see... or even sooner, we'll start to see the efficiency drop again. And we still have those mold issues and rust issues.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah. I'm aware of that.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: So... um... I did just want to show you some different equipment options.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Of course.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Oh my goodness. Who is this?

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Michelangelo. Come on out. Get out... Get out of here.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Aww. [Laughs] It's okay, I love cats.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Hi.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Hi. I have two cats and three dogs at home. So we have quite the chaos household.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: We have two. We have two cats.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: There you go. Yeah. So... to... two equipment options. Or there's a total of four that I've built. Um... There's either we replace like-for-like... um... which will naturally be more efficient, even though it's just going to be the updated version of what you have. It's going to be a new furnace, new coil, new condenser. Higher SEER rating, better efficiency. But still like the same type of equipment.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Mm-hm.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: The next step beyond that is maintaining gas heating, electric cooling, but upgrading efficiency. Um... and the interesting thing about that is that actually ends up being the most expensive one of the four that I've built. Um... Are you familiar with natural gas phase-outs in the area at all?

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: No... I don't know about that.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Okay. So it is something like... let's say for instance...

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Oh, is that... Yes.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Like we have stovetops being phased out. We do have gas water heaters being phased out. We have uh... gas furnaces being phased out. Are you familiar with what California's goal is in every home?

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Yeah, yeah. Some of that. Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: It's a really... I like the idea, it's just kind of a lot. Um, they want every house to have a 200 amp panel. They want every house to have a battery backup generator. They want every house to have solar. Uh, and they want every house to have a heat pump.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Mm-hm. Mm-hm.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: And so heat pumps are the next option. Um... Heat pumps are actually just got introduced some more rebates. So, even though those are the best possible system to install... weirdly enough, those actually are getting quite affordable at the moment. Um... I'm used to them being actually our most expensive option, but rebates have been introduced that have made it a lot more reasonable.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Okay. Interesting. Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: And then... um... when it comes to the uh... the two different uh... heating options, I just have two different types of heat pumps that I'm uh... building for you.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Okay. So like-for-like. Higher efficiency. Still... still same technology. And then two heat pumps.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Exactly. And so to start off with... um... I uh... it's always important to realize... these are more expensive than uh... than investments than your normal investment into a home, so... I just wanted you to understand that a lot of our clients do use different monthly options to take care of them. But let's just break down what we do. So let's start off with the like-for-like.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Mm-hm.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: We always come with our guarantees. We have some really, really excellent guarantees that really just show you that we're gonna do a great job for you. Um... We then start off with our first cost. Uh, this is a newest Nest thermostat.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Mm-hm.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: We can switch this up. I just wanted to just simplify it, put something in that you guys are used to.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Yep.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: It will be just the most modern version. And then we credit this back towards replacement at the very end. So this $549 will be credited back towards you. Then we talk about like steps... like what we need to do. AC removal, haul away and disposal, heater and removal.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Mm.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: This is a really lengthy section. Uh, this is like typically roughly one day... uh, this amount of work. Um... We de... uh... remove, safely demolish and dispose of your furnace. Uh... remove... safely remove the refrigerant.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Mm-hm.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Demolish and dispose of your AC.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Mm-hm. Mm-hm.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Um... and that's like... I think like a pretty lengthy section.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Got it.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: This next one may or may not come up, but I am including it as a line item. Just in case it becomes relevant.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Okay.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Um, sometimes when we have water damage... um... I do see decayed plywood in sections. Uh... where there could be like mold growth or anything like that. If we're seeing anything like that, we just cut that plywood out and put new plywood in for you.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Okay.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: That's in the inside.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Oh, yeah, yeah. Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Um... Next... the new system is not going to be the same dimensions. It's going to be um... a little bit smaller or a little bit wider, a little bit taller, something around there. And we do have to make sure the sheet metal connections fit to it. We do any sheet metal necessary.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Of course.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Outside we have a fuse box. It's where I remove it and work on it safely. We just put a new one in for you.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Mm-hm.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: All the new electrical. There will be some new electrical in there. Currently there's a little on-off switch in there called the safety shut-off. We always come with a new one. Um... any new thermostat wiring or connections... uh... any new electrical whips, we install that for you.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Got it.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Um... we have circuit breakers. Um... on the AC we just prefer to have a brand new circuit breaker, so we just include that with it. Um... thermostat wire, communication wire. This just means if there is a need to re-run a thermostat wire, we absolutely would.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Mm-hm.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: And then... HVAC permit. We always pull permits.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Mm.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Um... There is a uh... caveat for permit... um... replac... pulling. Usually we like to do a HERS test as well. Have you heard that before?

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Mm... No. I don't know what HERS test is.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: It's a... is it like an efficiency...

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: It's a home efficiency test. Um... And I... I do know right now your home would not pass a HERS test.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Probably won't.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Uh... because of the condition of the ducting... um... and a little bit of your insulation too.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Mm-hm.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Um... so we love to do HERS tests. But in order for us to feel confident in doing that, we would need to do a little bit with your ducting... um... or consider modifying it.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Mm-hm.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Um... what that would look like is something we do have a promotion going on currently... is _sealing_ your ductwork. Which just means no replacement, but we go to every single connection and seal it thoroughly. Um... and then we can include a HERS test if we do that.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Okay.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Um... Next... um... this is the total cost before any discounts. Um... I do have a fair amount of discounts that I've included. This is again the like-for-like option.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Mm-hm.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: And just to explain what it comes with... I explained our 410A... that refrigerant got phased out. We have the newest style here, R-32. This is basically just the new standard for refrigerant. It is considered to be better for the environment. Um... it's just much less harmful to ozone layers. Uh... In general, 35% cooling savings, 30% heating savings.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Mm-hm.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Um... It is going to be the same similar type of technology. The SEER rating is up. You currently have a 12 SEER. Uh... we install a 15.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Mm-hm.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: And then we always include standard filtration for you, as basic. Um... the motor is an improvement. So the fan motor inside of the system is an improvement. Way more reliable and way quieter. That's basically what this comes with.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Mm-hm. Mm-hm.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Now... a really cool thing... 10-year manufacturer warranty, 10-year compressor warranties. Um... If you're on this maintenance program with us, we actually completely match the manufacturer warranties.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Got it.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: It's essentially ten years parts and ten year manufacturer warranty. Um... And then... moving on, we'll just get to the first heat pump. Really very similar line items. I'm not going to go through every single one this time.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Mm-hm.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: I wanted to pause at this one though. The technology we're talking about with this heat pump... is called an Inverter. Have you ever heard of an inverter before?

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: I have. Yes.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Yeah. Actually, you know what? I saw your mini-split. Um... it... it actually mimics that technology but in a ducted sense. So that's a ductless heating and cooling system. This one we have that same type of inverter technology where it ramps up and ramps down...

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: That's right.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: ...except for just attaching it to the ductwork.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Got it.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: The main difference here, just important to... to realize, that it's going to heat and cool a little bit differently. In general, everything's going to be an improvement. Um... Cooling will be significantly better. Usually we're talking like 60% utility bill savings.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: That's right. Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: The... thing about heating side... is just important to note... Usually they don't like... absolutely kill it the same way old furnaces do. Um... Old furnaces have flames so obviously we're going to get really intense temperature coming out. These do heat a little bit less extreme, but still are totally capable of heating.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: I'm familiar with the heat pump. You know about these. Okay. Perfect.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Everything else is the same. AC removal, haul away and disposal, heater removal, plywood, circuit breaker, thermostat, permit. Um... and there's the price... um... before any discounts or rebates.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Mm-hm.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Um... We then have... um... our discounts and rebates, which I realize I didn't include on the old... on the other option here. But starting off, this... this existed on your other estimate too. Is $1800 off because we're able to re-use the copper line set.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Mm-hm.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Um... very resilient to time and corrosion. If my install crew does determine that your HVAC leak that you have right now is in your copper line, we just still take care of it.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Mm-hm.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Um... But even with this savings in place. Uh... Next we have the thermostat credit back towards you. And this is where we have some rebates.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Mm.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: So... Silicon Valley Clean Energy. I did just want to confirm, did you opt out of this program? You would have to manually opt out of it.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Yeah, I didn't opt out.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Okay. So you're good. So Silicon Valley Clean Energy is a $2500 off towards heat pump updates. Next we have TECH... which is one that just barely got re-introduced like yesterday.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Mm.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: So that's fantastic.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: That's fantastic.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: And, $1500 off here. Uh... what this is, is the fact that we're removing both a furnace and AC, qualifies you for this higher end uh... one. So we handle what we need to handle. There are things that you need to physically go in and do. The only one for uh... the SVCE... is you do... and we'll... this will be in a contract that you can just click on easily... You do need to submit a full PG&E bill. Like the every bit, every page of a PG&E bill.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Mm-hm.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Um... and then we do the rest. Um... We... what they need from us is proof that we've installed a... a inverter system... and the manufacturer label. So we take care of that.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Got it.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: For TECH... let's see. Yeah, I think we just take care of this one for you. So... Oh, you know what? This one does require a HERS test to be done.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Mm.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: So... for... for this area... I would love to include one of our promotions for you. Which is where we just include a duct seal. Um... And uh... that would be something I can definitely do. So if that passes a HERS test, I think you're all good.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: [Inaudible] ...clear record... with the city...

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Yeah. As long as you have no failed permits... um... then it should pass.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Failed permits meaning?

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Like you tried to pull a permit and it didn't work or pass... didn't pass inspection.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: I see. I see. For... for this house? Or... yeah. No, no problem.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Okay. So looks like you would qualify for this. Um... The next option will go to...

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Oh, what was that option? Oh, total price?

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: No, no, what was that option that you just showed me? A heat pump?

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Yep. So you can actually see what's kind of funny is it's relatively around the same price as... as a gas.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: And actually a little bit less expensive weirdly.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Yeah. And what's really cool, I was actually talking to Alex, that I was really impressed... I... I just built your best possible heat pump. Um... This is like our branded unit, it's a Daikin. Um... Daikin we love to work with because they really like us.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Mm-hm.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Um... if you ever look up Daikin products on Google and you like look up like install videos... you'll actually see my company installing them because we do the worldwide training for how to install Daikin. So we just have a great partnership with them. So we like to install them. But... what's interesting is Bryant does have a corner on... um... a type of technology. Heat pumps on occasion enter a defrost cycle. Which is where it... it briefly stops heating and it just runs itself alone to heat itself back up.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Mm-hm.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: These are known to not really enter that.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Mm. Which ones?

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: The Bryants.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: The Bryants.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Um... and it's just because of the way their coils are built. They have a just a better type of... uh metal derivative in it that is better at dissipating its own heat and keeping itself warm.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Mm.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: The only time these ever enter defrost, which we won't ever get to here in California, is when they enter 18 degrees Fahrenheit. So it just won't happen.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Mm-hm.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Um... And it's just really funny. If we look at like the really high end furnace, it's just like we really climb the costs. And I just...

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: I can see that.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: It's substantial.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: None of these options is moving the unit to the top?

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: No, currently I haven't built that. Um... It... We do have an attic package. I would actually have to modify these estimates to do that. The reason I'm starting like this, I just wanted you to understand what it would look like to keep it in the closet.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Sure.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Um... So when it comes to keeping it in the closet, we are completely fine moving it to your attic. We're completely fine. The thing I like to make sure my clients understand is serviceability, maintenance, and... um... efficiency... that is the best location.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Yeah, because it's too hot up there.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Precisely.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: What about moving it to the garage?

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: That would be way harder.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Harder?

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Harder. Because of that...

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: So much more work.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: We would actually be forced to replace your ductwork entirely.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Ah, okay.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: And... um... with this, the benefit of moving it up to the attic though, is you do get a full closet. Um... in general it... it is a pretty... in regards to airflow that enters the home, it's a pretty nice spot.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Mm-hm.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: It's just we do have to do some modifications so just to explain an attic install.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Mm-hm.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: That intake... would no longer be used.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: That's right.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Um... we would add one probably close to the center of the house.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Ah, okay.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: And our... our systems are very quiet, but it is just something that we will have airflow here now.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Sure.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Um... and then we do have to run some new electrical. If we're not doing a new gas line, that's great. Um... but we do have to install...

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: [Inaudible]

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: ...install the intake here. And... uh... Yeah. Closet systems in regards to what the system itself likes, is the best location. But at the end of the day, systems are built for you. So if we're moving it to the attic, completely fine. I... I kind of forget off the top of my head how much it adds to the project. It... It is depending on the severity of... of necessary ducting... I think it adds at least $4000 to it. Um... but on the highest end, it would involve new ductwork. Um... and then we add a fair amount to it. So.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Okay. Okay. Yeah, what we don't like about that... is not so much the... the cabinet, is the noise. So if...

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Oh, it's way quieter, any of our units that we install.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Yeah? That... that... that noise would like be better if we move it?

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Definitely. Definitely.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Yeah?

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: And what I can even do as an extra way to make that noise even better... is if we swap the grill.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Mm-hm.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: So the grill right now has louvers, right? So when airflow gets pulled in and it does this [Makes hand motion], that naturally creates noise.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Noise. Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: We can install an egg crate version that has just squares instead. And it's much much...

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: No way.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Much much better for airflow. And when that happens it makes it a lot quieter too. I did do a test one time on no changes other than the... the grill... and it did decrease noise by 20%.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Oh, I didn't know that.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: I did that. Um... so. 20% quieter. It would still get... on the noise... not... It would be much less... uh... noisy than this. But if we did do the basic furnace... that's not going to be as quiet. But if we talk about inverters, those actually can just sometimes be... Are these even on? Like you just do you even hear it running?

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Right. Right. Right.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: So...

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Okay. Okay. That makes sense. I... yeah, the inverter... I can hear it with the split unit... really quiet.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Yeah, so yeah that technology gets introduced here. All that to say if there's an incredible cooling demand, it still will pull a lot of airflow through itself.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Yeah, yeah. And that's where the noise comes from.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: But that won't happen that consistently. It would happen when it breaks 100 or when it's over 105. Then it might be... it'll still be quieter than that, but it will get to like equivalent air pressure [inaudible].

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Okay. Okay. All right. So the options I have are... can... can I see the prices again? So...

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: So all of these are going to be great options for you. Um... I do have to take this call. Feel free to review this.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: No problem. No problem.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: [Phone ringing] Hello? [Pause] Okay, um... I'm still talking to our client here about different options. So... I don't know. Yeah. Yeah. Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: [Background silence/shuffling][Hangs up phone]

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: I see that all these are... This one vent to the side?

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Yes. That's a big difference too is amount of room taken up outside. These are going to be taller systems. So it is a... it's actually... you know what? It'll be very, very... really, really close to the same height. But they're like this thin.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Um... so but they go... they go wide though.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Yeah. Yeah. Yeah, but I... my experience with the other one is that it vents to the side so it's kind of windy.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: It still will. It still will.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Yeah. And what I like about this one is that it vents to the top. Um...

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: I can build a form of inverter that does do that.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Yeah?

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Mm-hm.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: So they have this unit that vents up... upwards?

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: It's uh... the brand is Bosch.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Uh-huh.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Uh... very highly reviewed. Mostly actually highly reviewed from technicians. Which is very cool. Um... Technicians love working on them because they're very reliable. But I don't know where the Bosch would end up, but I do think it would be... uh... roughly in that same area.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Okay.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: The only thing and we can find out with Bosch in a second... but you see how this says Energy Star High Heat?

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Mm-hm.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Whenever you see Energy Star... that actually can qualify you for one further rebate that you have to deal with completely on your own. We can't help you.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Mm-hm.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Um... It's a tax cut rebate. And usually if you qualify for it, it's either $1000 or $2000.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Mm.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: If we don't have Energy Star on it, you can't have that rebate. And Bosch doesn't have that.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: I can find out.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Ah, okay. Okay. Okay. Got it. Got it.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Want me to just find out real quick?

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Um... Sure. Sure.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Okay. Let me just modify this estimate to be a Bosch.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: But leave that one there.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: I will. I was just going to duplicate it and we'll switch it over to a Bosch. So...

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: [Typing sound]

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Okay. It does have Energy Star on it. Um... so... The difference is this one will have... it won't have the high heat feature. Um... so let me just get... where did I put that estimate? It's this one right? No.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: [Background noise]

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: There we go. [Typing/Clicking]

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Okay. So now we have... Yeah, it's funny they all end up being in the same price range. So it's... um... again, in regards to technology... um... the only thing that the Bryant has over the other ones is that it doesn't enter defrost as often.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Mm. Mm-hm.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: In California that we really don't enter defrost all that much so.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: I had a heat pump before in another place... never had a problem with it. And this was like more than 20 years ago.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: And it was here in California?

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Yeah. So I think it's just... it will just very rarely enter a defrost cycle. But this one just has that better...

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Extra feature. Yeah. Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Exactly.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Okay. Okay. And how long does it take to install the system?

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: If we are doing a heat pump, it's going to be roughly two or three days.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Mm.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Because there is a lot of work that goes into a heat pump. If it was a gas system to existing AC, I would say one to two days.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Mm.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: And then there is still a promotion I haven't even included any of these. Um... and that would be duct sealing. Um... and uh that also can take close to a day too. But depending on time frames, we have an install crew or two out here for you. If you have two, it really speeds things up. So that's either two guys or four guys.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Mm. Okay. Okay. And um... All right. I understand the options. That's fine. Uh... I'm not... I would be interested on... on the heat pump. Uh... maybe these... these two. I'm not interested on the gas.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Sure.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: I do. Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: And for financing, can you show me the monthly payment? And for how long is that?

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: So we have different options. We have... let's go to the Bosch since that's the one that you like the idea of having airflow up. We'll look at financing. So we'll look at monthly offers. July. Okay. So these are just all of our options that we have. So we have an 120 month... 8.99 interest with autopay. So you don't have to do anything.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Mm-hm.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: 180, so much longer term, with 9.99. Um... This is our most... these two are our most commonly used.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Mm-hm.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: GoodLeap actually just barely like... just gave us access to this this month. Um... it was supposed to end on the 15th so I'm surprised it's still going on. But... the 12 months no interest just means that if you do pay it off in 12 months...

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Mm.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: You just paid the same as cash. Like there's no uh interest rate or anything. Uh this is just a very common one because the low interest rate. Um... and it just goes on for a little bit of a longer term. Um and yeah I think when it comes to this one that we're seeing... when it comes to this payment that we're seeing there, that's including the 5.99 one for this for this 60 months.

transcript.text: Mm. 60 months. So five years...

transcript.text: Five years.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Five year... 335. And that... um... that includes uh... the promotions everything and... okay.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Yeah there's still some line items in regards to promotions I haven't included but uh this is base line equipment at the moment. Yeah.

transcript.text: And what is the monthly payment with the one that you showed me that I can pay off earlier? In a... in a year? That that type of one?

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: So you don't _need_ to pay anything for a full year if you don't want. You actually do have the ability to take a year off of payments entirely.

transcript.text: Oh.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: But then...

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: But then it goes to that... I think it's not a nasty interest rate, it's something around 10%. Oh I see what you're saying.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: It's not a... it's not a horrible, horrible interest rate but there is an interest rate there.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: So oh so basically paying the full amount within the year and then whatever...

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: But the nice thing is is you don't need to pay anything for the year either. Um, so if we did pay it off in 12 payments let's say...

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Uh-huh.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: It would be a little bit over 2000 a month.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Ah I see. Because it's within a year. Yeah yeah yeah yeah.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Within a year. But then I think the terms actually go really really close. It's like five years of um I think 9.99 from there. But the the nice thing though is let's say you don't pay it off in full. Let's say you go to the year and maybe you put 18,000 down. So we still have a remaining balance of... we still have a remaining balance of 8422. What then happens is the interest only applies to that remaining balance.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Oh.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: So we only get remaining balance so that would then...

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: [inaudible]

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: Yeah. So we we just get that remaining balance and then divide it by 60. That would be like your monthly payment at that point.

transcript.speaker: Homeowner
transcript.text: Yeah I get it. I get it. For five more years. Yeah I get it.

transcript.speaker: Technician
transcript.text: But yeah but then you can pay it off early and it's no big deal.

transcript.text: Of course. Of course. I get it. Okay. Um... So look. I I'd like to uh speak with my wife about all the options. Email me this and then uh of course I'll um let's cover the the what you did today and then I'll just discuss this with my wife.

Um, the other thing is we can see what options you qualify for in regards to financing. And if that's the case, if we have financing, then I don't even need a down payment today. We would just do just the financing side of it. And we do come with a—every contractor that's reputable comes with this guarantee here. So as you're talking to your wife, if anything weird comes up we even have this notice right here. So we always have a reputable 3 day right to cancel. So.
